column4: CarlC0X-> all you have show is your loopback interface, where is your eth0 or eth1 ?
TTreshoem worked fine last night. then i used apt-get to remove networkmanager. then i installed back networkmanager with apt-get as well... then worked fine... but today... i see this problem
its set for auto. i didnt mess with the IPs
the reason was having some problem while installing pidgin. and an error message said to disable network manager. and didnt work. so i removed it :)
yes i know the difference. but i just gived a try. i just want to start with linux. im a very newbie :)

i have asked a simple question., u can either help or not. no need to be ironic. ... and in order to learn things i dont need to make a fresh install for every little thing. im sure there must be a way around

its not my first install i assure u. i even installed debian and backtrack as well. i know how to install. now i just need to step ahead. so a fresh install wont help me. i need to learn how to fix things alright :)
making a fresh install for every failure isnt a solution. means ill have to reinstall 5 times a day? :)
i see ure a little bit ironic. but u should be. being more advanced in linux doesnt make you smarter. it just makes u linux advanced :)
following the installation wizard doesnt give me any feeling about whats going on with my network manager :)
yes i know its strange. but it worked last night after i re installed :)
yes host is fine, im using the host now. plus i can use wireless in ubuntu guest too
yes works fine. i can get ubuntu online via wireless
im controlling the wireless from the ubuntu guest (the one which doesnt work otherwise)
tell me where to look at and ill check it out
